result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Perry J Nelson

defendant.name: Nelson, Perry J
defendant.address: Washington County Jail 500 N Schmidt Rd, West Bend, WI 53095

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victims or their families. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with any minors. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

1:15 PM Defendant Perry J Nelson appeared by video via Zoom, in custody w/o counsel; Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. This is refiling of prior case that was dismissed; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond and scheduling; Def. response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 11/10/22 at 8:30am in Br. 3 & Review 11/9/22 at 8:15am in Br. 3 per DA (already scheduled); Court sets $250,000 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victims or their families. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with any minors. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
and Motion for Cont. of Initial to 11/3/22
and Motion for Cont. of Initial to 11/3/22

10:34 AM Defendant Perry J Nelson appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Teri Strohschein appears for the SPD office - eligible. Atty Tienstra heard, case 22CF203 will be dismissed. Defendant has not received copy of Criminal Complaint. Atty Strohschein requests to adjourn. Court heard will adjourn initial appearance.
